results.title: Loch Lomond
results.creator_credit: Laurence Henson, Films of Scotland and IFA (Scotland)
results.brief_description: A study of human and wild life throughout the year, in, on, and around Loch Lomond. Gives a picture of the life and work of a Highland community - the wild life conservator, research biologist, shepherd, farmer and publican, all of whom know the Loch in its many moods.

results.title: Loch Ladies
results.brief_description: This film showcases the many women who drive business in the small Loch Village. The four women featured are representative of the many others who are involved in running businesses in the main street of Loch. These women are smart, funny, hard working and driven individuals who have turned their passion into profit.

results.title: Loch Eck day/night dissolving magic lantern slides
results.brief_description: Day becomes night over Loch Eck in these dissolving magic lantern slides. Dissolves created transitions between scenes by superimposing matching projections and carefully dimming one slide while brightening the other.
results.description:
Day becomes night over Loch Eck in these dissolving magic lantern slides. Dissolves created transitions between scenes by superimposing matching projections and carefully dimming one slide while brightening the other. 

Other common dissolving effects included transforming black-and-white images into dazzling colour and conjuring heavenly or devilish figures into scenes to bewitch and beguile audiences. Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.
description_for_label:
Day becomes night over Loch Eck in these dissolving magic lantern slides. Dissolves created transitions between scenes by superimposing matching projections and carefully dimming one slide while brightening the other. 

Other common dissolving effects included transforming black-and-white images into dazzling colour and conjuring heavenly or devilish figures into scenes to bewitch and beguile audiences. Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.

results.title: Localising troubles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
An intercarrier sound receiver using the flyback high voltage supply is used as a typical example in explaining how to identify trouble symptoms and localise them in a specific section of the receiver by studying the three indicators present in the receiver itself - raster, picture and sound.

results.title: Local traffic: a suburban dilemma
results.brief_description: Sandringham is a suburb where through traffic is causing problems in local streets. The program follows the process whereby residents press their local council to take action on the problem. A firm of consultants is appointed and we see the following five stages at work: the study, the proposal, the survey, the debate and the outcome.

results.title: Local newspaper
results.brief_description: The story of a typical local newspaper - an actual one, the Newbury Weekly News - and of the market town community it serves. Mr Hugh Turner, the editor, a familiar figure in the town, directs the paper, as his father did before him, independently of any big financial group and without fear or favour. The weekly newspaper, local in ownership and range of interests, goes out to be read eagerly and talked over throughout the whole community.

results.title: Local interest
results.brief_description: An overview of the developmental work of the six school support centres in the Southern Metropolitan Region in 1988. Managers explain the various programs being undertaken in the region and the cooperation between schools and the community.

results.title: Local Hero
results.brief_description: A story about the Dallas-style dramas that disturb a quaint Scottish village when a Houston-based oil company plan to buy the seaside town and turn its beach into a refinery site. Contrary to expectations, the eccentric local residents are only too eager to oblige with the sale of their homes. Starring Burt Lancaster.
